intro: Parathesis membranacea, commonly known as the membranous parathesis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a delicate, papery texture. This species is native to certain regions of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and mild aromatic properties.
